1: <sup>1</sup> Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth: and unto them were sons born after the flood.
2: <sup>2</sup> The sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.
3: <sup>3</sup> And the sons of Gomer; Ashkenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.
4: <sup>4</sup> And the sons of Javan; Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.
5: <sup>5</sup> By these were the isles of the Gentiles divided in their lands; every one after his tongue, after their families, in their nations.
6: <sup>6</sup> And the sons of Ham; Cush, and Mizraim, and Phut, and Canaan.
7: <sup>7</sup> And the sons of Cush; Seba, and Havilah, and Sabtah, and Raamah, and Sabtechah: and the sons of Raamah; Sheba, and Dedan.
8: <sup>8</sup> And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be a mighty one in the earth.
9: <sup>9</sup> He was a mighty hunter before the LORD: wherefore it is said, Even as Nimrod the mighty hunter before the LORD.
10: <sup>10</sup> And the beginning of his kingdom was Babel, and Erech, and Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
11: <sup>11</sup> Out of that land went forth Asshur, and builded Nineveh, and the city Rehoboth, and Calah,
12: <sup>12</sup> And Resen between Nineveh and Calah: the same is a great city.
13: <sup>13</sup> And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,
14: <sup>14</sup> And Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (out of whom came Philistim,) and Caphtorim.
15: <sup>15</sup> And Canaan begat Sidon his first born, and Heth,
16: <sup>16</sup> And the Jebusite, and the Amorite, and the Girgasite,
17: <sup>17</sup> And the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,
18: <sup>18</sup> And the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite: and afterward were the families of the Canaanites spread abroad.
19: <sup>19</sup> And the border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, as thou comest to Gerar, unto Gaza; as thou goest, unto Sodom, and Gomorrah, and Admah, and Zeboim, even unto Lasha.
20: <sup>20</sup> These are the sons of Ham, after their families, after their tongues, in their countries, and in their nations.
21: <sup>21</sup> Unto Shem also, the father of all the children of Eber, the brother of Japheth the elder, even to him were children born.
22: <sup>22</sup> The children of Shem; Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram.
23: <sup>23</sup> And the children of Aram; Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Mash.
24: <sup>24</sup> And Arphaxad begat Salah; and Salah begat Eber.
25: <sup>25</sup> And unto Eber were born two sons: the name of one was Peleg; for in his days was the earth divided; and his brother’s name was Joktan.
26: <sup>26</sup> And Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
27: <sup>27</sup> And Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,
28: <sup>28</sup> And Obal, and Abimael, and Sheba,
29: <sup>29</sup> And Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab: all these were the sons of Joktan.
30: <sup>30</sup> And their dwelling was from Mesha, as thou goest unto Sephar a mount of the east.
31: <sup>31</sup> These are the sons of Shem, after their families, after their tongues, in their lands, after their nations.
32: <sup>32</sup> These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their generations, in their nations: and by these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.
